context: A semi-industrial bioscrubber unit was then produced, and the water/cutting oil system was used to test the process on a larger scale. VOCs mixtures Two mixtures were used. The first one (1) was prepared by mixing equal liquid masses of the following 11 compounds: • Oxygenated compounds: methanol, acetone, methyl ethyl ketone (MEK), methyl isobutyl ketone (MIBK), ethyl acetate (EA), butyl acetate (BA) [Carbo Erba Reagenti, 99%]. • Aromatic compounds: toluene, ethylbenzene (EB), p-xylene [Carbo Erba Reagenti, 99%]. • Halogenated compounds: 1,2 dichloroethane (DCE) and dichloromethane (DCM) [Carbo Erba Reagenti, 99%]. For the second mixture (2), p-xylene was replaced by xylene [Carbo Erba Reagenti, 99%].Laboratory unit In order to determine the apparent mass transfer coefficient and concentration at saturation of the VOCs, the following setup was used. An impinger, (500mL) which contained a 200mL water-cutting oil mixture, was fed by a gas flow (60Lh−1) containing VOCs (Fig. 1 ).

llm_generation.summary: In this context, ethylbenzene is categorized as one of the aromatic compounds included in a mixture of volatile organic compounds (VOCs) used for testing in a semi-industrial bioscrubber unit. The mention of ethylbenzene alongside other aromatic compounds like toluene and p-xylene indicates its classification within this group, but there is no detailed discussion of its specific properties or interactions with the other compounds.
